title: Report: Mark Buehrle will throw two innings Sunday, then retire
text:
Former White Sox pitcher Mark Buehrle will throw two innings on Sunday before calling it quits on a stellar 16-year career, according to Bruce Levine of 670 The Score .
Two more innings would bring the Toronto pitcher to 200 innings pitched for a 15th consecutive season. No other active pitcher has more than nine .
Buehrle, 36, isn’t expected to be included on Toronto’s postseason roster .
Buehrle was drafted by the White Sox in the 38th round of the 1998 draft, and pitched in Chicago for 12 seasons from 2001 to 2011.
He’s 214-159 with a 3.81 career ERA .
Buehrle is perhaps most fondly remembered by White Sox fans for pitching the 18th perfect game in MLB history on July 23, 2009 at U.S. Cellular Field. In 2005, he also became the first pitcher in World Series history to start and save consecutive games.
